headline: Keurig Dr Pepper Announces Updated Financing Plan for JDE Peet's Acquisition
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. (NASDAQ: KDP; "the Company") today announced updated financing plans and transaction timelines for the acquisition of JDE Peet's and subsequent planned separation into two independent companies ("Beverage Co." and "Global Coffee Co." pending the announcement of official corporate names).

raw.headline: Keurig Dr Pepper Announces Updated Financing Plan for JDE Peet's Acquisition

(NASDAQ: KDP; "the Company") today announced updated financing plans and transaction timelines for the acquisition of JDE Peet's and subsequent planned separation into two independent companies ("Beverage Co." and "Global Coffee Co." pending the announcement of official corporate names).

headline: American Express Hits Dow Jones On AI Doomsday 'Work Of Fiction'
summary: American Express dragged the Dow Jones Industrial Average lower on Monday afternoon as investors responded to a bleak 2027 AI-driven recession scenario published by Citrini Research, a firm that offers thematic and global macro trading ideas.  The firm says it's bullish on AI's potential and wonders about the economic implications if the impact is so far-reaching that it turns out to be bearish.  American Express, Capital One Financial, Blackstone Financial and KKR were among companies in Citrini's fictional write-up that were among Monday's biggest S&P 500 laggards.

headline: Is It Too Late To Consider KKR (KKR) After Recent Share Price Pullback?
summary: If you are wondering whether KKR at around US$101 a share still represents sensible value, or if most of the easy gains are behind it, you are not alone. The stock has slipped about 0.5% over the past week, 16.6% over the last month and 21.5% year to date, although its 3 year and 5 year returns of 88.0% and 131.8% present a very different picture for longer term holders. Recent coverage of KKR has focused on its role as a large alternative asset manager and its ongoing deal activity. This...
